A person was advised by his orthopedician to get regular dressing of his wound done. But the patient did not give care. The patient visited after some time at which time the orthopedician again advised regular dressing but did not do the dressing himself as he said he was busy. Finally the wound enlarged and the underlying bone developed osteomyelitis. Which statement is true?

options.label: A
options.text: The doctor is not guilty under contributory negligence

options.label: B
options.text: Doctor is guilty under last clear chance doctrine

options.label: C
options.text: Doctor is guilty under avoidable consequences rule

questions.correct_answer: B. Doctor is guilty under last clear chance doctrine
